derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French scarifier, via late Latin from Greek skariphasthai 'scratch an outline', from skariphos 'stylus'
late 18th cent.: formed irregularly from scare, perhaps on the pattern of terrify

means.word_mean: 1. puncture and scar (the skin), as for purposes or tribal identification or rituals;

sentences.sentence: "The men in some African tribes scarify their faces"
